So far: about 210,000 people in the U.S. have died from COVID-19, indicating that COVID-19 is more deadly than the flu.
COVID: 19 is estimated to be about 10 times more deadly than the seasonal flu, based on the infection death rate.
The CDC reports that flu is most deadly: while the risk of complications for healthy children is higher for flu compared to COVID-19. This suggests that COVID-19 is not less lethal than the flu for most populations.
